node.title: One of the biggest surprises about overseas travel didn't hit Anna until she'd landed
node.alt: Anna Davey in a backyard with her two children.
node.description: For Anna Davey, returning to Ireland after two and a half years has brought a mix of emotions â€” and the arrival of Omicron has only added to it.
node.content:
["For Anna Davey, returning to Ireland after two and a half years has brought a mix of emotions.", "\"The day that Scott Morrison started saying that we might be going to open up the borders on the first of November and you might be able to travel, I just cried straight away, because it's a lot of emotion, not being able to go home for so long,\" she said.", "Australia's borders had been\u00a0closed\u00a0long enough for the\u00a0Brisbane resident\u00a0to bring a one-year-old into the world \u2014 a little girl who until last week had never met much of her family.", "However, for Ms Davey,\u00a0visiting her overseas home in the middle of a pandemic with two small kids in tow was a daunting task.", "Outbound international travel began to pick up in November after COVID-19 stripped overseas trips back to only the most dire of circumstances for most people.", "Queensland remains mostly closed to international arrivals \u2014 but\u00a0Anna found some surprising upsides to departing from\u00a0the\u00a0\"ghost town\" that Brisbane International Airport had become.", "", "
Anna Davey says\u00a0the airport was like a ghost town ahead of their departure.(Supplied: Anna Davey)
", "\"In some ways, things were\u00a0easier because there weren't many people there. They had time. There weren't heaps of queues,\" she said.", "\"In a funny way, it's like a ghost town\u00a0but, in another way, you get more service because there's nobody there.\"", "Some airlines now recommend international travellers arrive at their airport four hours before their flight due to increased boarding requirements.\u00a0", "But Ms Davey nearly didn't get that far.\u00a0", "\"We were on our way to the airport, two kids in the car, everybody big, high hopes, really anxious, about to get on this flight, and my husband said to me, 'Do you have your PCR test results printed out?', because he was dropping us to the airport,\" she said.", "\"I said no. I haven't got them yet, and I\u00a0was like, 'Oh, no'.\u00a0That was an awful feeling.", "\"I didn't have the results and my flight was in three hours.\"", "", "
Once on the plane, Anna\u00a0Davey says,\u00a0there was an air of excitement.(Supplied: Anna Davey)
", "Australia does not require outbound travellers to produce a negative test, however many countries, including Ireland, do require one to enter.", "Ms Davey was able to obtain her result by calling the pathologist that administered the test but warned fellow travellers to ensure that their results arrived on time.", "Despite\u00a0the surreal experience of departing a near-empty airport\u00a0where you couldn't\u00a0even buy a pre-flight snack, she found there was actually an air of excitement once on\u00a0board.\u00a0", "\"I thought, 'Oh gosh, I'm going to be with two kids, I have a baby who's going to need to be walked to sleep or rocked to sleep \u2014\u00a0are they going to let me do that?'\"\u00a0she said.", "\"Are they going to feed us on the plane? How am\u00a0I going to wear a mask because she always pulls it off me?", "\"On the plane, there was a huge feeling of relief.\u00a0I think they're really happy to be travelling again.\u00a0I think they're happy to see families travelling.\u00a0", "
Children viewed differently in COVID-struck Ireland
", "While the flight was smooth, Ms Davey said one of the biggest shocks came once she'd arrived at her destination.", "\"Small children are kind of like a pariah \u2014\u00a0people don't want small children touching things or they don't want to get too close to small children, which I hadn't anticipated,\" she said.", "\"Because children aren't vaccinated, there's a real sense here that children are carrying it and children are going to give it to you.", "On Sunday, Australia's Therapeutic Goods Administration\u00a0provisionally approved the Pfizer vaccine for children aged between five and 11 years of age.", "In Ireland, children under 12 years are not\u00a0eligible to be vaccinated.", "The Republic of Ireland, which has a population of 5 million people, has had more than twice as many cases and deaths as\u00a0Australia has had.", "It's recorded more than 565,000 cases of COVID-19 since the start of the pandemic, and more than 5,600 deaths.", "In Ms Davey's\u00a0state of Queensland, only seven people have died of COVID-19.", "
Omicron raises questions for Australians' travel plans
", "Ms Davey and her children arrived in Ireland just hours before South African authorities announced their discovery of the B.1.1.529 variant of COVID-19, which the World Health Organization later dubbed\u00a0Omicron, a \"variant of concern\".", "\"We have this Omicron coming along as well, which is making me really nervous because I feel like I've taken a huge risk,\" she said.", "\"I don't know if I'll be able to come back in as easily as I thought I would.\"\u00a0", "", "
International travel remains complicated for many.(AAP: Bianca De Marchi)
", "The new variant \u2014 which scientists still know little about \u2014 has\u00a0led to some countries completely closing themselves off to international travel.", "Others, like Australia, have reeled back some entry freedoms, however, the international border remains relatively open to NSW, Victoria and the ACT.", "All fully vaccinated Australian citizens and permanent residents are free to leave Australia without an exemption, however, restrictions are in place for people entering the country.", "People entering NSW or Victoria from most of the world are able to fly into Sydney or Melbourne airports but must get a PCR test within 24 hours of arrival and isolate for 72 hours. Further PCR testing requirements also apply.", "However, Ms Davey\u00a0said that, for her and many other people with families overseas, any amount of testing would be worth it to see the people they care about.\u00a0", "\"I really don't mind. I'm getting to see my family for the first time in two and a half years. If they want to test me every week, I really don't mind,\" she said.", "\"The uncertainty of being able to go back to my husband and to Brisbane, that is really difficult, but having to do a little COVID test, you know, you're travelling internationally. I really don't mind doing that.\"", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
